reviews.title: Spent 9 Nights
reviews.text: Stayed Feb. 10, 2007 through Feb. 19, 2007 on the 5th floor. Booked via http://cheaprooms.com/. Great location - 1 block inside of Chinatown and within walking distance (2 to 3 miles) of most everything worth seeing. I paid $64 a night when the average for a SF hotel room is $170. Downside - the place is like me: older and a bit run down. This truly is a case of getting what you pay for. I have two versions for you here.

reviews.title: Stayed there several times
reviews.text: First one … I stayed in a room without a view. Also, I could hear everyone in the rooms around me - could hear when then talked, coughed, showered, flushed, walked, had the TV on, threw up, etc. EVERYTHING. I even passed gas once and the people in the next room laughed. Coincidence? I don't think so. The room and bath were really small. The place is run down but not dirty – no bad smells (beyond what I caused). Very friendly staff (and I’m not one to normally give out compliments). Thing is, for all the stuff that most snooty people would consider ‘unfit’, I was fine with. If you’re there to just spend time in your room, why did you come in the first place? I was normally to bed by 10 PM and up around 5:30 AM. Most everyone around me, according to shower noises, were up and running by 6:30 AM.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second version: My daughter stayed a couple of doors down from me and said she couldn’t hear any of what I mentioned hearing – said she couldn’t hear anyone in any of the rooms around her. Go figure. Also, she loved the view her room had of Grant Ave. And her room seemed a bit larger and nicer though I paid exactly the same price for it as the one I had.
reviews.title: No problems, Excellent Location!!!

reviews.text: Final assessment: I’m 50 and would go there again. My daughter, 25, said she would also stay there again. I could easily have afforded much better but wanted something centrally located because I wanted to walk around SF, not drive. I did rent a car for 2 days to visit some sites further out (garage parking is on Sutter just 2 blocks from the Grant Plaza and cost $8 a night).
reviews.title: get what you pay for
Poor service, noisy and uncomfortable
reviews.text: This is an old family-run hotel that serves its purpose, as far as I'm concerned: giving you an affordable place to crash in a decent location. I stay there when attending computer conventions down at the Moscone Center, and most other hotels in the area cost twice as much, which can really add up over the week.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed there three nights past week (Aug.9th, 12th & 13Th,2007.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel

reviews.text: The location was great right at the edge of chinatown and easy to
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: get to other attractions. The staff was courteous and rooms were
reviews.title: Not that great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: clean and spacious (Room with two double beds).I would recommend this hotel for budget minded traveler.
reviews.title: Decent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just stayed for a few days at Grant Plaza. Location was perfect for us Our room was spacious and clean (we think it was the one shown in the brochure) The staff were very helpful. We thought it was good value
reviews.title: Awful hotel!

likes.liked: — only the location - at the heart of China Town
likes.disliked: — the stuff, the small room size and doutable cleanliess, the paid internet in the lobby, everything

reviews.text: When I arrived and saw the lobby, it looked nothing like the photos on the website. The interior is run down, the elevator is rickety and a little scary to ride in. The room I had was extremely small, dirty and it smelled. The hotel hallways and my room smelled musty and of mildew. If you're looking for a cheap place to stay then this is it. However, you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the photos!

likes.liked: — The location..close to shopping, dining, cable car

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.text: Oh my God!

I am a hardened traveller and this was the worst hotel I have ever come across. The website is false advertising. The room was extremely small, so small in fact that there was nowhere to open my case other than on the bed. My feet hung off the end of the bed. I am tall but I have never had this problem in a hotel before. Lastly, the room was insecure with a window opening onto a courtyard that couldn't be locked. I asked to be moved but they claimed they had no other rooms so I moved out to the Astoria around the corner. MUCH better!.
reviews.title: Cold at night

likes.disliked: — No heat, poor communication from staff

reviews.title: Great place, great price!
reviews.text: Compare my photos - The first is from their website, the second is what I actually got.

I stayed in this hotel several times over the past 15 years; the last time was around 8 years ago. This time I stayed there 3 nights. The location is decent, especially for Union Square, Chinatown, and North Beach sightseeing, but other than dim sum, there's really no place (that I'm aware of at least) to get a reasonably priced, quick hot breakfast nearby anymore since the McDonald's that was 2 blocks away closed.
reviews.title: Grant Plaza :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has bedbugs! It is a dump! We were scheduled to stay 2 nights and we checked out early the next morning. We arrived around 8pm so it was too late to find anything else. We got out of there ASAP! I asked the desk clerk if they had ever had anyone else complain about bedbugs and he said "yes" a couple of months ago, but it proved to not be. I disagree with him and recommend that you avoid this hotel.
reviews.title: Do not stay here!

likes.disliked: — Bedbugs - mattress was horrible - sinks into the middle.

reviews.text: We went a couple of blocks from there and stayed at the Sir Francis Drake for the remainder of our stay. A lot pricier, but well worth the money!
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: I was a little skeptical of the place because of the mixed reviews that I had read here, but I really liked the hotel. The room was very small (double bed, about 4 feet to one side, one foot on the other, and a few feet at the end of the bed) but it was all I needed. The bed was VERY comfortable, the shower was great (hot water, good pressure). The hotel doesn't have air conditioner, but the weather was nice so it wasn't an issue. It is a little loud- I heard my neighbors shower every morning.
reviews.title: adequate especially for the price

reviews.text: Overall, I would stay there again anytime- the location and price can't be beat.
reviews.title: The best budget Hotel in the best city in the world.......(honestly!)

reviews.text: you can't find anything else in san francisco for the price unless its a hostel. hotel was in good location. stayed for 8 days. the room was small but my bed was firm; the room was clean. my room was on busy grant ave,but the noise wasn't too bad.
reviews.title: Basic, Clean, Great Location and CHEAP
